SEARCH
Package simu.model

Class Passenger

java.lang.Object
simu.model.Passenger
public class Passenger extends Object
Domain object representing a single passenger in the simulation.

A Passenger is stamped with its arrival time (from Clock), assigned a running identifier, and randomly designated with several boolean attributes based on configurable Bernoulli fractions: priority status, whether check-in is required, whether luggage drop is needed, and whether the passenger is an EU citizen.

Randomness invalid input: '&' fractions

  • Fractions are global (static) and apply to all new passengers.
  • Values ≤ 0 produce false, values ≥ 1 produce true, otherwise a sample is drawn from a shared Random.
  • When a fraction is exactly 0 or 1, outcomes are deterministic.

Logging

The constructor logs a creation message via Trace. Ensure the trace level is initialized before constructing instances in tests.

Thread-safety

This class is not thread-safe due to shared static state (identifier counter and cumulative sum). If you use it from multiple threads, guard updates externally or confine usage to a single thread.

    • reportResults

      public void reportResults()
      Reports this passenger's timing results to the trace and updates the global cumulative service time.

      Logs arrival, removal, and residence time (removal - arrival) via Trace. Adds the residence time to the global sum, computes a simple running mean as sum / id, and prints it to System.out.

      Note: The computed mean uses the per-instance id as the divisor. This matches a “first N passengers” average only if every passenger up to this id has called reportResults() exactly once.
